issue.title: [CF 714] Unable to get Buffs proc to show
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. There isn't any error message
2.
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
I see the tool bar with my Buff icons. When they proc the tool bar does nothing. No timer or indication they are on

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v6.1.0

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

^1^T^STextLayouts^T ^Sicon1^T ^N1^T ^t^N2^T ^t^t^t^SGroups^T ^N1^T ^SPoint^T ^Sy^F8715033696265977 ^f-46^Sx ^F5061151649632235^f-45 ^Spoint^SBOTTOM ^SrelativePoint^SBOTTOM ^t^SScale^F5854584388699458 ^f-52^SIcons ^T^N1^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SUnit^SVorttium ^SOnlyMine^B ^SSort^N1 ^SType^Sbuff ^SShowTimerText^B ^SClockGCD^B ^SShowPBar^B ^SName^S125481 ^SEnabled^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SShowCBar^B ^SFakeHidden^B ^t^N2^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Swpnenchant ^SName^S104425 ^SClockGCD^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEnabled^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^t^N3^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SOnlyEquipped^B ^SType^Sitem ^SOnlyInBags^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^SClockGCD^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^SEnabled^B ^SName^SRelic~`of~`Yu'lon ^t^N4^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SOnlyEquipped^B ^SType^Sitem ^SOnlyInBags^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^SClockGCD^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^SEnabled^B ^SName^SMithril~`Wristwatch ^t^t^t^t^SVersion^N61022 ^t^N61022^S~`~| ^Sprofile^SVorttium~`-~`Sen'jin ^^

> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

Are you sure that TellMeWhen is locked when you are wanting them to function? TellMeWhen has two states - Locked, which is used when you want icons to function; and Unlocked, which is used when you are configuring your icons and groups. To toggle between locked and unlocked states, type '/tmw' into chat (without quotes).


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you for the screenshot! Disregard my previous comment, as it looks like TMW is indeed locked from your screenshot.

The problem is that you are using the incorrect spellIDs to track your buffs. In most cases, it is always best to use the name of the buff instead of the ID unless there is a particular situation where you need to differentiate between multiple buffs that share the same name.

Try changing all of your icons to track the buffs by name instead of ID and let me know if that fixes the problem. Thanks!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Will do, thanks.


> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

That did not work, I posted ss of the options to show you that i have the spell typed out and not the spell id number. With the lightweave it could not find it. It only accepted the spell id number.


> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

OK. I will be able to further diagnose the issue when I get home in a few hours (I don't have my authenticator with me right now so I can't test it in-game).

For lightweave, though, the name of the buff is just "Lightweave" (you want to check for the name that is in the tooltip of the buff that you are checking for, not the name in the tooltip of the enchanting profession spell), not "Lightweave Embroidery".


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Ah, ok. fixed the lightweave , with no success. Even /reload once I changed it. Look forward to hearing back. Thank you for your support


> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

Have the same problem with dots. Applied dots don't displayed.

> Posted by CurseForge user KRinSk

Does r679 (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/) fix the issue for you?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Sorry no it does not. I even deleted the previous one, and installed the new one fresh. V6.1.1

  • added version number
Edited Nov 28, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

For your windsong icon: The description of the Weapon Enchant icon clearly states that it is for tracking temporary weapon enchants. Windsong is not a temporary enchant. You should be using a buff/debuff icon to track this.

For your lightweave icon: You have this icon set to always hide. You need to uncheck that option if you wish for it to ever show. You also have the power bar overlay option enabled, but lightweave is not a spell that costs you any resources.

Here is a revised export string of your setup:

^1^T^SPoint^T ^Sy^F8715033696265977 ^f-46^Spoint ^SBOTTOM^SrelativePoint ^SBOTTOM^Sx ^F5061151649632235^f-45 ^t^SScale^F5854584388699458 ^f-52^SEnabled ^B^SIcons ^T^N1^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SOnlyMine^B ^SSort^N1 ^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SLightweave ^SClockGCD^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^SEnabled^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^t^N2^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SWindsong ^SClockGCD^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^SEnabled^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^t^N3^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SOnlyEquipped^B ^SType^Sitem ^SOnlyInBags^B ^SName^SRelic~`of~`Yu'lon ^SClockGCD^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^SEnabled^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^t^N4^T ^SShowTimer^B ^SOnlyEquipped^B ^SType^Sitem ^SOnlyInBags^B ^SName^SMithril~`Wristwatch ^SClockGCD^B ^SOverlay_BarGCD^B ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SShowCBar^B ^SEnabled^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^t^t^t^N61103^S~`~| ^Sgroup^N1 ^^

Edited Nov 28, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@KRinSk: Go

Please do not hijack others' tickets. Please create a new ticket if you would like help with the issues that you are experiencing (and please be thoroughly descriptive about what the specific issue that you are experiencing is.)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Great news, got the procs to work on the weapon enchant and lightweave. The trinkets do not work


> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

Neither the Relic of Yu'lon nor the Mithril Wristwatch are trinkets that have On Use effects. The description for the Icon Cooldown icon type clearly states that it only tracks the cooldowns of items with Use effects.

You will need to use the Internal Cooldown icon type in order to track the cooldowns of these two trinkets. Please be sure to read all of the tooltips that you see as you set this up - especially the tooltip for the Internal Cooldown icon type, as well as the tooltips for the Triggered By settings, and most importantly the text contained in the big yellow popups that may appear.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Did what you suggested. Still can't get it to work. When the Relic of Yu'lon proc's the icon in the tool bar goes blank, then reappears when the proc is over. The Mithril Wristwatch does nothing on the tool bar. I attached ss of both settings and trinkets in action


> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister

The name of the buff that procs from Mithril Wristwatch is called "Now is the Time!", not "Mithril Wristwatch".

For both icons, you did not put in the duration of the cooldown of the trinket. You need to put the duration of the trinket in, not the duration of the buff.

In the future, if you need more help, please post the export strings of the icons that you are having trouble with. Export strings are easier for you to provide to me, and they are easier for me to look at and figure out what is wrong.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you very much for you help, and your great addon, Got everything working =)


> Posted by CurseForge user soupyblister
